citeinfo.title: Florida Black Bear Other Mortality Locations, 1990-2016

descript.abstract: This dataset contains the locations of Florida black bear (Ursus americanus floridanus) mortalities, excluding roadkill data, within the state of Florida, maintained by the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC). In this shapefile, we used only those records maintained by the FWC from which we could obtain a geographic coordinate.
descript.purpose: To display the locations and the associated attributes of black bear mortalities, excluding road kills, in the state of Florida. The roadkill data are in a separate spatial dataset.

idinfo.accconst: These data are unrestricted. Where possible, always acquire this dataset directly from FWC as other sources may have altered the original data.
idinfo.useconst: Users should read and fully comprehend this metadata record prior to using these data. Please acknowledge the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC) as the data source for any products developed from these data. If any data are modified, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area may be inaccurate. Users should acquire the best available data. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of these data.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute

attracc.attraccr: Quality checked visually for attribute accuracy and consistency.

dataqual.logic: Logically consistent. All attribute values fall within defined values
dataqual.complete: Visually inspected for completeness to ensure all values fell within specified ranges.

srcinfo.srccontr: Dataset describing Florida black bear activity in the state of Florida.

procstep.procdesc: GIS Data Manager received tabular data. Created XY event, selected all records with lat/longs and exported into shapefile. Joined dataset with detailed county shoreline to QAQC to ensure points landed in correct couny. Returned errors to bear program staff and fixed or removed as deemed appropriate.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute

enttyp.enttypd: Florida black bear other mortality locations, 1990 - 2016

attr.attrdef: Final action taken if FinAction is OTHER
Reason for capture if CapReason is OTHER
Final action taken if bear was alive
Zip code in which report was placed
City in which report was placed
Community/Subdivision in which report was placed
FWC region where mortality took place

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated

attr.attrdef: FWC Bear Management Unit where mortality took place

attrdomv.udom: Form and coordinate defining the feature

attr.attrdef: Estimated age by tooth cross section
Reason for capture if CapReason is Nuisance
Cause of mortality for carcass if CauseMort is OTHER

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Bear deceased when personnel arrived on scene

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute

The user assumes all responsibility for the accuracy and suitability of this data set for a specific application. In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer
